Reviews.Content: There has been a great range of comments on Motel Blu in reviews. Here is what I can tell you from my personal experience which is happening as I write. Pluses: ++ great room rate for Miami area ++ conventient area to get to Miami, Miami Shores, Hollywood, Fort Lauderdale ++ quiet ++ wonderful pool and pool area ++ secure parking ++ tile floors (none of those don't-know-what's-in-them carpets ++ quiet A/C that does not blow directly on the bed like many upscale places ++ free WIFI ++ TV works and get more channels than I get at home ++ really comfy beds!!!! Minuses: -- yep - two pillows per room - that's it -- yep - two towels per day (no hand towels, no face clothes -- no phone (but when was the last time I used a room phone in the cell phone age == missing hardware like towel bar -- no clothes hangers Not-sure-abouts? ?? location: anyone who is familiar with mixed use neighborhoods will not be threatened by the location (at the next corner is a Wendy's and a Taco Bell, a block away is a large Grocery Store, and in the streets around the Motel there are a mix of businesses, multi-family and single family homes, churches, and some night spots), but if you are more comfortable with suburbs where businesses are at a distance and people are not walking the streets at night, this might not be the place for you. ?? window shades - yes, they are the old roller type, and then may not stay down or close tightly to the window walls, but if you are traveling without a travel roll of duct tape (not to mention a good multi-tool device with screwdriver, etc) you are asking for trouble anyway. (And this is not a slam at Motel Blu, because I have had to tighten screws and tape shuts items in much fancier places. Hey, things fall apart and don't work, and it is unlikely that a skilled maintainence person is onstaff at midnight no matter how great the lodging. And as Arthur Dent could tell you (Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy) you should always be carrying a towel anyhow. Overall, were I need to be in this area again, I would stay here - can't beat the price and I hate spending hundreds of dollars just to sleep for 8 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Confluence of cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: zsurbej
Reviews.Content: Confluence of cockroaches! Management very unkind, very dirty beds (pubic hair, stains), All drains clogged, stinking room, a very poor area, dirty bath towels. TERRIBLE! Price performance ratio outrageously!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't stay!! Absolutely filthy and unhealthy. Cockraoch Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: DebRFranksville_WI
Reviews.Content: We reserved a prepaid room based on the description in Travelocity. What a mistake. It was in a really seedy neighborhood, far from the airport. The room was absolutely horrible. Burn holes in the sheets, an old-fashioned pull down shade that was so old, it curled in on the sides and did not cover the entire window. We had a first floor room so anyone could look in the window whenever they wanted. And there were enough characters hanging around outside to make one think that would happen. The bathroom sink had more cigarette burns in it than not. I can only imagine what the smokers were doing in there to necessitate them contantly putting down their cigarettes. They couldn't be washing up because no soap was provided. The towel rack was broken, but then again, the only towels provided were thread-bare bath towels - no wash clothes nor handtowels, and the bath towels were laid on the filthy bedspread, thereby un-useable. Worst of all - cockroaches - and plenty of them. They were crawling across the pillows as I called Travelocity to complain and was advised by Travelocity to ask the management to clean the room. What a joke. We called a cab and spent the night on the floor of the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Drug and Prostitution Activity Prohibited”
Reviews.Author: Doberman88
Reviews.Content: This is how I approached the entrance to this motel - a big old sign reading "zero tolerance of prostitution or drug activity". The motel was in a very bad area - as we pulled up to the motel, there was a "live nude show" next to the motel. As I walked into the lobby to check-in, I was very alarmed to see the front desk enclosed in bullet-proof glass. Obviously, the actual room wasnt much better. Thankfully, it was just my husband and myself - but I would feel very bad if a young family had reserved to stay here. We couldn't even walk anywhere without getting accosted for money by street bums. Out of the 3 nights we were supposed to stay, we only stayed one - and the only reason we even did that was because our original flight in, was delayed - causing a very late arrival and lost luggage. Since the luggage was to be dropped off later at our hotel, we stayed. We get our room, no tv remote, no garbage can, food left in fridge, someone else's dirty clothes left behind in room, no toilet paper dispenser, mold on shower curtain and bathtub. A total of 2 bath towels, that were thread-bare and stiff. Overall the room was extremely shabby - site indicated that motel was recently remodeled - I hate to think what it looked like before. We checked out the next night and the clerk informed us that we would still be charged for the entire stay, even though we only actually stayed one night. Dont be deceived by there website - because it was clearly not as advertised. I wasn't looking for a fancy place, just something with decent staff, safe environment and basic amenities - this motel had none.
